name: Rochester Champs-Elysees Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent a week at the Rochester in August and I cannot recommend it as a four star experience. The room's carpeting was stained, there was mold in the shower and the towels were horrible. Most of the staff were nice amd spoke excellent English. There is a metro stop a few steps away, but you need to change trains at the next station to get anywhere near the major tourist destinations. As described in previous reviews, the internet hardly ever worked. We did get a courtyard room and it was pretty quiet.
reviews.title: Not a four star experience

likes.disliked: — the room was not clean and the location was inconvenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would not stay there again.
reviews.title: excellent hotel

likes.disliked: — turn left out of hotel for nearst tube

reviews.text: GREAT option - close to two metro stops, the Champs-Elysees, attractions... walking distance to just about anything. Quiet street at night, very modern hotel with easy Internet connections in the lobby, modern bathrooms, flat screen tvs, clean.... Fantastic. Couldn't have asked for more in the heart of Paris!
reviews.title: GREAT option

reviews.text: After a fair bit of desk research ,we opted for the Rochester.
reviews.title: Safe pair of hands

reviews.text: Instinct took me to a Left Bank boutique number, but the hotel's practicality won me over (we were in Paris for a party in the next door street ie. stumbling distance).
reviews.title: SPOTLESSLY CLEAN, EXCELLENT LOCATION!

reviews.text: It's absolutely fine in a functional, comfortable, marbley sort of way. Not big on charm; front desk fairly surly and the hotel bar was closed both the Friday and Saturday night we were there (maybe there isn't really one).
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Perfect Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Redeeming points are the exceptional location - seconds away from the Champs Elysees - and the price, which i though was pretty reasonable for a 'four star' hotel in that part of town. Try doing the same in London....
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel

likes.liked: — spacious and comfortable rooms and bath, location

description: Located only two steps from the Champs Elysées and rue du faubourg Saint Honoré, the Hotel Rochester Champs Elysées, is happy to welcome you in a setting combining luxury, charm and tradition.Welcome to the hotel:The Hotel Rochester, 106 rooms and suites, in the heart of the busy area of the Champs Elysées, is the ideal place for business or leisure trips.The hotel will charm you thanks to its warm setting and refined atmosphere.
